trait.name: Shadow of the Eye
trait.tooltip: Reduced Vitality Known to the Orcs of Mordor as shakglob, or Stone-filth, the Stout-axes have long served as thralls of the Dark Lord of Mordor. After enduring years of tireless labour and ill-nourishment, the Stout-axes have lost some of the sturdiness they once possessed.
trait.description: Reduced Vitality Known to the Orcs of Mordor as shakglob, or Stone-filth, the Stout-axes have long served as thralls of the Dark Lord of Mordor. After enduring years of tireless labour and ill-nourishment, the Stout-axes have lost some of the sturdiness they once possessed.

trait.name: Unyielding Will
trait.tooltip: Increased Will Despite suffering many centuries of thralldom, the will of the Stout-axes has never broken.
trait.description: Increased Will Despite suffering many centuries of thralldom, the will of the Stout-axes has never broken.

trait.name: Doom of Drsa's Folk
trait.tooltip: Reduced Fate Drsa's Folk were a cruel people, and the Ring given to their king by Sauron led them into war against their kin. When the Dark Lord demanded the Ring's return, however, they refused, and his armies besieged and sacked their halls. The Enemy took many of the survivors back to Mordor as prisoners, forcing them to toil in the mines and pits of the Black Land for centuries. Stripped of their history, their clan name, and even their own language, they became a lost people. As years passed, they adopted a new clan name: the Stout-axes.
trait.description: Reduced Fate Drsa's Folk were a cruel people, and the Ring given to their king by Sauron led them into war against their kin. When the Dark Lord demanded the Ring's return, however, they refused, and his armies besieged and sacked their halls. The Enemy took many of the survivors back to Mordor as prisoners, forcing them to toil in the mines and pits of the Black Land for centuries. Stripped of their history, their clan name, and even their own language, they became a lost people. As years passed, they adopted a new clan name: the Stout-axes.

trait.name: Wrought by the Black Land
trait.tooltip: Increased Might and Agility, improved resistance to Shadow and Disease It is whispered that Sauron bred some among the Stout-axes using the same methods that had produced the mighty Uruk-hai and Olog-hai. Whether that is truly so is unknown, even to the Wise, but it is certain that the Stout-axes have grown accustomed to the unforgiving realm of Mordor.
trait.description: Increased Might and Agility, improved resistance to Shadow and Disease It is whispered that Sauron bred some among the Stout-axes using the same methods that had produced the mighty Uruk-hai and Olog-hai. Whether that is truly so is unknown, even to the Wise, but it is certain that the Stout-axes have grown accustomed to the unforgiving realm of Mordor.

trait.name: Nimble-handed
trait.tooltip: As a Stout-axe, you wield axes and daggers with a nimbleness known to few other dwarves.
trait.description: As a Stout-axe, you wield axes and daggers with a nimbleness known to few other dwarves.

trait.name: Needful Ingenuity
trait.tooltip: Your ingenuity and craft-skill proved your worth in the eyes of the Dark Lord and spared you from Sauron's wrath. You are able to more easily hone your craft-skill.
trait.description: Your ingenuity and craft-skill proved your worth in the eyes of the Dark Lord and spared you from Sauron's wrath. You are able to more easily hone your craft-skill.

trait.name: Unwritten Destiny
trait.tooltip: The fate of the Khirvsa might still be rewritten. As a Stout-axe, you now count yourself among the Free Peoples of Middle-earth.
trait.description: The fate of the Khirvsa might still be rewritten. As a Stout-axe, you now count yourself among the Free Peoples of Middle-earth.

trait.name: Virtuous Stout-axe
trait.tooltip: You have held close the virtues that served you well in Barad-dr. What it means to be a Stout-axe is represented strongly in you. This trait does not apply to unequipped or capped Virtues.
trait.description: You have held close the virtues that served you well in Barad-dr. What it means to be a Stout-axe is represented strongly in you. This trait does not apply to unequipped or capped Virtues.

trait.name: Heart of Fire
trait.tooltip: A fire burns in the hearts of the Stout-axes. Although it was diminished in the depths of Barad-dr, it was never truly extinguished.
trait.description: A fire burns in the hearts of the Stout-axes. Although it was diminished in the depths of Barad-dr, it was never truly extinguished.

trait.name: Stout-shield
trait.tooltip: After years of toil in Mordor, your skin has hardened to stone. Through great concentration you have learned to more effectively block attacks - even without the use of a shield.
trait.description: After years of toil in Mordor, your skin has hardened to stone. Through great concentration you have learned to more effectively block attacks - even without the use of a shield.

trait.name: Fortitude of the Stout-axes
trait.tooltip: You spent many years in the shadow of the Dark Lord. You are able to inspire your Fellowship to resist Shadow.
trait.description: You spent many years in the shadow of the Dark Lord. You are able to inspire your Fellowship to resist Shadow.

trait.name: Return to Thorin's Hall
trait.tooltip: Although it cannot match the lost splendour of Usk-tga, you have been welcomed as a friend in the halls of the Longbeards. You are able to quickly return to Thorin's Hall in Ered Luin.
trait.description: Although it cannot match the lost splendour of Usk-tga, you have been welcomed as a friend in the halls of the Longbeards. You are able to quickly return to Thorin's Hall in Ered Luin.

trait.name: Flame-tempered
trait.tooltip: The fires of Orodruin are well-known to the Stout-axes, and you have adapted to better endure blistering heat and flames found elsewhere in Middle-earth.
trait.description: The fires of Orodruin are well-known to the Stout-axes, and you have adapted to better endure blistering heat and flames found elsewhere in Middle-earth.

specialEffect.label: Brash Invitation generates 3 Mettle. Come At Me generates 3 Mettle.

trait.name: Innate Strength: Raw Power
trait.description:
Quick Attacks grant the buff 'Innate Strength: Raw Power', increasing the Brawlers damage.
If a Quick Attack is performed while 'Innate Strength: Raw Power' is still active, the buff is instead advanced to a higher tier, to a maximum of Tier 4.

specialEffect.label: Tier 1: +5% Damage Tier 2: +10% Damage Tier 3: +15% Damage Tier 4: +25% Damage

trait.name: Innate Strength: Deflecting Technique
trait.description:
Balanced Attacks grant the buff 'Innate Strength: Deflecting Technique', increasing the Brawlers chance to Parry.
If a Balanced Attack is performed while 'Innate Strength: Deflecting Technique' is still active, the buff is instead advanced to a higher tier, to a maximum of Tier 4.

specialEffect.label: Tier 1: +2.5% Parry chance Tier 2: +5% Parry Chance Tier 3: +7.5% Parry Chance Tier 4: +10% Parry Chance

trait.name: Eager Challenger
trait.description: You excel at drawing ire.

trait.name: Innate Strength: Intimidating Presence
trait.description:
Quick Attacks grant the buff 'Innate Strength: Intimidating Presence', increasing the Brawlers ability to generate threat.
If a Quick Attack is performed while 'Innate Strength: Intimidating Presence' is still active, the buff is instead advanced to a higher tier, to a maximum of Tier 4.

specialEffect.label: Tier 1: +5% Threat Generated Tier 2: +10% Threat Generated Tier 3: +15% Threat Generated Tier 4: +20% Threat Generated

trait.name: Flurry of Blows
trait.description: Using Pummel causes the next use of Pummel to deal additional damage. This effect may stack up to 3 times, and is permanent until you exit combat or logout.

specialEffect.label:
Using Pummel increases the damage of subsequent Pummels by 10%.
This effect may stack up to 3 times, and is permanent until you exit combat or logout.

trait.name: Innate Strength: Clever Technique
trait.description:
Balanced Attacks grant the buff 'Innate Strength: Clever Technique', increasing the Brawlers Finesse Rating.
If a Balanced Attack is performed while 'Innate Strength: Clever Technique' is still active, the buff is instead advanced to a higher tier, to a maximum of Tier 4.

specialEffect.label: Tier 1: Modest Finesse Rating Bonus Tier 2: Minor Finesse Rating Bonus Tier 3: Finesse Rating Bonus Tier 4: Greater Finesse Rating Bonus

trait.name: Enhanced Battle Flow
trait.description: Inspired by legendary strikers of the past, call upon incredible strength.

stat.name: Skill_Brawler_PipBasedDamage_Multiplier
stat.descriptionOverride: Increases the bonus from Battle Flow by ${PERCENTVALUE} of its base value. This bonus stacks with Battle Fury.

trait.name: Like a Stinging Nettle
trait.description: No one gets a free hit on you.

specialEffect.label: When the Brawler Parries or Evades an attack, they deal damage to their attacker.

trait.name: Innate Strength: Inner Resilience
trait.description:
Heavy Attacks grant the buff 'Innate Strength: Inner Resilience', increasing the Brawlers mitigations.
If a Heavy Attack is performed while 'Innate Strength: Inner Resilience' is still active, the buff is instead advanced to a higher tier, to a maximum of Tier 4.

specialEffect.label: Tier 1: +1% Mitigations Tier 2: +1.5% Mitigations Tier 3: +2% Mitigations Tier 4: +2.5% Mitigations

trait.name: Strong Jaw and Nimble Feet
trait.description: Gain resistance to all forms of CC.

specialEffect.label: Iron Will protects against all CC for 6 seconds.

trait.name: Innate Strength: Precision

specialEffect.label:
Set-up attacks reduce the active cooldown of the following skills by 1s: Joy of Battle Iron Will Weather Blows Draw a Line in the Sand Battle Fury Joy of Battle - Damage Joy of Battle - Heal Efficient Strikes
This effect cannot occur more than once every 2 seconds.

trait.description: Feint grants a bonus to Evade.

trait.name: Disruptive Opponent
trait.description: Rattled has a longer duration.

trait.name: Seize an Opportunity
trait.description: Striking an enemy with maximum stacks of Rattled will unlock quick reaction skills.

trait.name: Momentous Hit
trait.description: Gain the skill: Momentous Hit.

trait.name: Deep Breaths
trait.description: Take a Breath healing is more effective.

trait.name: Capable Rider
trait.description: On the Heavy War-steed, your War-steed requires less power to execute its skills.

trait.name: Destabilizing Strikes
trait.description: On the Light War-steed, some of your skills have a chance to dismount your enemy. Ranking up this trait will increase the dismount chance.

stat.name: Trait_Mount_Burglar_Dismount_Chance_Target
stat.descriptionOverride: Increases dismount chance for some skills by ${PERCENTVALUE}
